snippet: After a seven-month review by the Obama administration, very few deportation cases have been halted, disappointing immigrants the president hopes to court for his re-election bid.
abstract: Obama administration has halted fewer than 2 percent of the 411,000 deportation cases before the nation's immigration courts; the low number of closed cases falls far short of expectations raised among immigrants when administration officials announced they would review all deportations and halt those involving noncriminals with strong ties to the country.
lead_paragraph: After a seven-month review by the Obama administration, very few deportation cases have been halted, disappointing immigrants the president hopes to court for his re-election bid.

headline.main: Deportations Continue Despite U.S. Review of Backlog
headline.print_headline: Deportations Go On Despite U.S. Review Of Backlog
